trans-unit.source: Conditional access in Azure AD allows you to configure per-application multi-factor authentication access rules and the ability to block access for users not on a trusted network.
trans-unit.target: Conditional access in Azure AD allows you to configure per-application multi-factor authentication access rules and the ability to block access for users not on a trusted network.

trans-unit.source: Azure Conditional Access Preview for SaaS Apps
trans-unit.target: Azure Conditional Access Preview for SaaS Apps

trans-unit.source: The Azure Conditional Access for SaaS apps is available for public preview.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Conditional Access for SaaS apps is available for public preview.

trans-unit.source: The preview allows you to configure per-application multi-factor authentication access rules and the ability to block access for users not on a trusted network.
trans-unit.target: The preview allows you to configure per-application multi-factor authentication access rules and the ability to block access for users not on a trusted network.

trans-unit.source: You can apply the multi-factor authentication rules to all users that are assigned to the application, or only for users within specified security groups.
trans-unit.target: You can apply the multi-factor authentication rules to all users that are assigned to the application, or only for users within specified security groups.

trans-unit.source: Users may be excluded from the multi-factor authentication requirement if they are accessing the application from an IP address that in inside the organization’s network.
trans-unit.target: Users may be excluded from the multi-factor authentication requirement if they are accessing the application from an IP address that in inside the organization’s network.

trans-unit.source: These capabilities will be available to customers that have purchased an Azure Active Directory Premium license.
trans-unit.target: These capabilities will be available to customers that have purchased an Azure Active Directory Premium license.

trans-unit.source: Configure per-application access rules
trans-unit.target: Configure per-application access rules

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to configure per-application access rules.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to configure per-application access rules.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the Microsoft Azure Portal as Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the Microsoft Azure Portal as Administrator.

trans-unit.source: On the left pane, select Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: On the left pane, select Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: On the Directory tab, select your directory.
trans-unit.target: On the Directory tab, select your directory.

trans-unit.source: Select the Applications tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the Applications tab.

trans-unit.source: Select the application that the rule will be set for.
trans-unit.target: Select the application that the rule will be set for.

trans-unit.source: Select the Configure tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the Configure tab.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down to the access rules section.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down to the access rules section.

trans-unit.source: Select the desired access rule.
trans-unit.target: Select the desired access rule.

trans-unit.source: Specify the users the rule will apply to..
trans-unit.target: Specify the users the rule will apply to..

trans-unit.target: Understanding access rules

trans-unit.target: This section gives a detailed description of the access rules supported in the Azure Conditional Application Access Preview.

trans-unit.source: Specifying the users the access rules apply to
trans-unit.target: Specifying the users the access rules apply to

trans-unit.source: By default the policy will apply to all users that have access to the application.
trans-unit.target: By default the policy will apply to all users that have access to the application.

trans-unit.source: However you can also restrict the policy to users that are members of the specified security groups.
trans-unit.target: However you can also restrict the policy to users that are members of the specified security groups.

trans-unit.source: The Add Group button is used to select one or more groups from the group selection dialog that the access rule will apply to.
trans-unit.target: The Add Group button is used to select one or more groups from the group selection dialog that the access rule will apply to.

trans-unit.source: This dialog can also be used to remove selected groups.
trans-unit.target: This dialog can also be used to remove selected groups.

trans-unit.source: When the rules are selected to apply to Groups, the access rules will only be enforced for users that belong to one of the specified security groups.
trans-unit.target: When the rules are selected to apply to Groups, the access rules will only be enforced for users that belong to one of the specified security groups.

trans-unit.source: Security groups can also be explicitly excluded from the policy by selecting the Except option and specifying one or more groups.
trans-unit.target: Security groups can also be explicitly excluded from the policy by selecting the Except option and specifying one or more groups.

trans-unit.source: Users that are a member of a group in the Except list will not be subject to the multi-factor authentication requirement, even if they are a member of a group that the access rule applies to.
trans-unit.target: Users that are a member of a group in the Except list will not be subject to the multi-factor authentication requirement, even if they are a member of a group that the access rule applies to.

trans-unit.source: Conditional Access Rules with MFA
trans-unit.target: Conditional Access Rules with MFA

trans-unit.source: If a user has been configured using the per-user multi-factor authentication feature, this setting on the user will take precedence over the app multi-factor authentication rules.
trans-unit.target: If a user has been configured using the per-user multi-factor authentication feature, this setting on the user will take precedence over the app multi-factor authentication rules.

trans-unit.source: This means a user that has been configured for per-user multi-factor authentication will be required to perform multi-factor authentication even if they have been exempted from the application multi-factor authentication rules.
trans-unit.target: This means a user that has been configured for per-user multi-factor authentication will be required to perform multi-factor authentication even if they have been exempted from the application multi-factor authentication rules.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about multi-factor authentication and per-user settings.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about multi-factor authentication and per-user settings.

trans-unit.source: Access rule options
trans-unit.target: Access rule options

trans-unit.source: The current preview supports the following options:
trans-unit.target: The current preview supports the following options:

trans-unit.source: Require Multi-factor authentication: With this option the users that the access rules apply to will be required to complete multi-factor authentication before accessing the application the policy applies to.
trans-unit.target: Require Multi-factor authentication: With this option the users that the access rules apply to will be required to complete multi-factor authentication before accessing the application the policy applies to.

trans-unit.source: Require Multi-factor authentication when not at work: With this option a user that is coming from a trusted IP will not be required to perform multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: Require Multi-factor authentication when not at work: With this option a user that is coming from a trusted IP will not be required to perform multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: The trusted IP ranges can be configured on the multi-factor authentication settings page
trans-unit.target: The trusted IP ranges can be configured on the multi-factor authentication settings page

trans-unit.source: Block access when not at work: With this option a user that is not coming from a trusted IP will be blocked.
trans-unit.target: Block access when not at work: With this option a user that is not coming from a trusted IP will be blocked.

trans-unit.source: The trusted IP ranges can be configured on the multi-factor authentication settings page.
trans-unit.target: The trusted IP ranges can be configured on the multi-factor authentication settings page.

trans-unit.source: Setting rule status
trans-unit.target: Setting rule status

trans-unit.source: Access rule status allows turning the rules on or off.
trans-unit.target: Access rule status allows turning the rules on or off.

trans-unit.source: When the access rules are off the multi-factor authentication requirement will not be enforced.
trans-unit.target: When the access rules are off the multi-factor authentication requirement will not be enforced.

trans-unit.source: Access rule evaluation
trans-unit.target: Access rule evaluation

trans-unit.source: Access rules are evaluated when a user accesses a federated application that uses OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, SAML or WS-Federation.
trans-unit.target: Access rules are evaluated when a user accesses a federated application that uses OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, SAML or WS-Federation.

trans-unit.source: In addition access rules are evaluated when the OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect when a refresh token is used to acquire an access token.
trans-unit.target: In addition access rules are evaluated when the OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect when a refresh token is used to acquire an access token.

trans-unit.source: If policy evaluation fails when a refresh token is used, the error invalid_grant will be returned, this indicates the user needs to re-authenticate to the client.
trans-unit.target: If policy evaluation fails when a refresh token is used, the error invalid_grant will be returned, this indicates the user needs to re-authenticate to the client.

trans-unit.source: Configure federation services to provide multi-factor authentication
trans-unit.target: Configure federation services to provide multi-factor authentication

trans-unit.source: For federated tenants, multi-factor authentication (MFA) may performed by Azure Active Directory or by the on-premises AD FS server.
trans-unit.target: For federated tenants, multi-factor authentication (MFA) may performed by Azure Active Directory or by the on-premises AD FS server.

trans-unit.source: By default, MFA will occur at a page hosted by Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: By default, MFA will occur at a page hosted by Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: In order to configure MFA on-premises, the –SupportsMFA property must be set to true in Azure Active Directory, by using the Azure AD module for Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: In order to configure MFA on-premises, the –SupportsMFA property must be set to true in Azure Active Directory, by using the Azure AD module for Windows PowerShell.
